title: Include docs from the CLI help via a symlink
Include the docs paths relative to CARGO_MANIFEST_DIR
Add support for escaping dollar signs in strings
Add string.replace
body:
- Tidy up the justfile
- Add string.replace

title: Update to Rust 1.62
body:
- Disable clippy warning in Parser::make_error
- Listen to clippy

title: More documentation tweaks
body:
- Add the packed numbers page to the help importer and docs tests
- Remove language/introduction.md and add more info to language/_index.md
- Add a guide page regarding the prelude
- Add a 'getting started' page to the guide
- Improve various parts of the guide
- Roll the 'value assignments' page into 'language basics'

title: Swap the order of iterator.repeat's arguments
Guide followups
body:
This PR contains followups from working on the language guide.

The main user-facing change is that it removes the use of `+` with Lists and Maps (that don't implement `@+`), and adds `list.extend` and `map.extend` as an alternative.

title: Update Dependencies
body:
- Run cargo update
- Update to indexmap 1.8.2
- Update to pulldown_cmark 0.9.1
- Add a note about the MSRV and bump it to 1.58.1

title: Add a language guide
body: This PR includes the first version of a language guide, along with a few fixes that were found while it was being worked on.

title: Prepare for Rust 1.62
body:
This PR fixes a couple of clippy lints that show up in the current 1.62 beta.

- Prefer write! & writeln! over appending the result of format! to strings
- Prefer unsigned_abs() over casting abs() to unsigned

title: Test the documentation examples
body:
- In preparation for making a documentation website, tweak the documentation markdown so that it's more easily digestible by a website generator.
- Make the examples testable and validate their output.
- Fix some core library issues noticed while going through the docs.

title: Improve the parsing of lookups on container declarations
body:
- Fix parsing of lookups on multiline container declarations
- Unify the parsing of tuple and list entries
- Clean up parse_lookup a bit

title: Fix parsing of indented arithmetic expressions
Parser cleanups and loop improvements"
body:
This PR includes some cleanups in the parser and some looping improvements.

- The result of loop expressions (`for`, `while`, `until`, and `loop`) can now
  be assigned to a value, with the default result being the final expression 
  in the loop body. 
  - If no loop iterations are performed then the result is `null`.
- The `break` keyword can now take an expression, which will be returned as 
  the result of the loop.
  - e.g. 
    ```koto
    y = for x in 0..=10
      if x == 5
        break x * x 
    y
    # 25
    ```

title: Syntax improvements
body:
- Reintroduce mandatory curly braces for comma-separated map definitions
- Allow comma-separated values inside braces to have flexible indentation

title: Remainder operation improvements
body:
- Refer to the modulo operator as the remainder operator
- Return NaN instead of panicking when integer `%` divisor is zero
- Make assert_near's margin of error optional

title: Remove support for nesting multiline comments
body:
This makes it easier to toggle code blocks, e.g.
     
```coffee
#--
# Adding a '#' to the start or end of the line above toggles the code in the line below
print 'hello'
#--#
```

title: Meta map improvements
body:
- Make a ValueMap's MetaMap optional
- Introduce map.with_meta_map / get_meta_map

title: Explicitly disable raw mode when exiting the REPL
REPL improvements
body:
- Prefix REPL results with an arrow
- Print out REPL results in bold
- Add REPL support for the Delete key
- Remove unnecessary io.print imports in tests
- Correctly support unicode characters in the REPL
- Avoid using process::exit when exiting the REPL
- Move the REPL cursor using a calculated x position instead of moving relatively

Fixes #127.
Fixes #130.

title: Null improvements
body:
This PR introduces a `null` keyword as the preferred alternative to the existing `()` syntax for creating non-values. The code and documentation now refer to `null` / `Null` instead of `()` / `Empty`.

Additionally, bool coercions have been introduced, following the Lua pattern `null` coercing to `false`, and all other values coercing to `true`.

This allows for using `or` as a [null coalescing operator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Null_coalescing_operator) in Koto, rather than introducing a new keyword or operator.

e.g.
```coffee
foo = |x|
  x = x or 42 # Previously you would need to write `x = if x == null then 42 else x`
  print x

foo()
# 42
```

title: Always attempt to access IDs, even when no result is requested
body:
Accessing an ID without side effects would previously be optimized away,l which led to the confusing situation where a missing ID could be accessed in a  script without triggering an error.

e.g. 

```coffee
x = 123
y # <-- The compiler would previously optimize this away, so no runtime error would be thrown
debug x
```

title: Build with Rust 1.59
body:
- The first argument to unreachable must be a string literal
- Listen to clippy

title: Avoid returning temporary tuples in multi-assignment expressions
Core lib improvements
body:
- Make list.clear() return the List instead of Empty
- Add more trigonometric functions and constants
- Add num2.angle
- Add lerp functions
- Add iterator.repeat
- Add iterator.generate

title: A couple of tweaks
body:
- Add DataMap::remove_with_string()
- Update the random lib's dependencies and add wasm/js support

title: Clean up the value stack in Vm::run() before exiting
body:
This was an oversight in a77e843a2d25428cf47237a8cd5db34fd5483d12, the
temporary registers that are pushed onto the value stack for the execution frame
need to be cleaned up before `run()` exits.

title: Error message improvements
body:
- Remove unused function
- Improve the span placement for binary operations
- Improve the wording of some error messages
- Replace parser error macros and place some error spans more clearly

title: Avoid panics in the Koto API
body:
- Avoid panics in the top-level Koto wrapper
- Add From<MetaMap> impl for Rc<RefCell<MetaMap>>
- Clean up a few things in MetaMap

title: Switch to using the 2021 edition
body:
- Switch to using the 2021 edition
- Remove imports of items in the 2021 prelude
- Listen to clippy
- Specify Rust 1.58 as the minimum version

title: Further import improvements
body:
- Allow import to work with previously-imported maps
- Accept negative numbers in list.get, tuple.get, and map.get_index
- Rework run_import to ensure cleanup is followed in all cases
- Make the core op 'not found' error message more helpful

title: Add a 'module imported' callback
body:
This PR includes various cleanups and replaces the 'for each module path' mechanism added in #142 with a callback that gets called whenever a module is imported, which will be simpler to use for clients that need to keep track of a script's dependencies. 

The PR also includes `clear_module_cache`, which is useful when reloading scripts when dependencies have changed.

title: Add koto.for_each_module_path
body:
- Add koto.for_each_module_path to provide access to loaded module paths
- Move assertion checks to runtime_failures
- Make use of Result::map to simplify return paths in the parser

title: Add support for named wildcard / placeholder arguments
body:
- Add initial support for named wildcards
- Add support for named wildcards to for loops
- Add support for named wildcards to try/catch blocks

title: Improvements to parsing Lists, Maps, and Tuples
body:
- Allow multi-line lists to be declared more flexibly
- Enable permissive expression parsing for list entries
- Allow multi-line maps with braces to be parsed more flexibly
- Allow multi-line tuples to be parsed more flexibly
- Allow empty tuples to be created with (,)
- Don't allow double commas in tuple or lists

title: List / Num2 / Num4 / Random improvements
body:
Various improvements found while playing around with Koto.

- Allow the list.resize value to be omitted
- Add list.resize_with
- Add num2.with / num4.with
- Remove support for setting Num2/Num4 elements by index
- Allow the default random generator functions to used directly
- Rename the random number2/number4 functions to num2/num4
- Switch the random generator from ChaCha20 to ChaCha8

title: More iterator improvements
body:
- Allow `iterator.chunks` and `iterator.windows` to be used with more iterator types
- Rework `ValueIterator` to use trait objects for all iterator types
- Add `iterator.reversed`

title: Iterator improvements
body:
Resolves #128.

- Allow maps to overload `@iterator`
- Allow num2/num4 values to be used in a for loop
- Add `iterator.chunks`
- Add `iterator.windows`
- Add `iterator.flatten`

title: Advent of Code Day 15
body:
Changes that came up while working on Advent of Code day 15.

- Fix initialization of missing args when temporary registers have been used
- Reintroduce 'then' in match and switch arms with indented blocks

title: `num2`/`num4` improvements
body:
Resolves #133.

- Replace num2/num4 keywords with core library functions
- Add iterator.to_num2 / to_num4
- Add x/y/z/w/r/g/b/a getters to num2 + num4
- Update the changelog

title: Advent of Code Day 14
body:
Various improvements that came up while working on Advent of Code Day 14.

- Fix a 'subtract with overflow' error that can occur when using `iterator.skip`
- Add `string.from_bytes`
- Remove unnecessary error prefixes in iterator adaptors
- Change functions so that they capture previously exported values

title: Add time utilities to the os module
body:
Adds `os.start_timer` and `os.time`.

- Relax the ExternalData trait requirements
- Call @display when printing out result values in the REPL
- Fix bug with temporary results being lost when calling overloaded ops
- Add time utilities to the os module

title: Import commonly used core lib functions by default
body:
Functions like `io.print` and `test.assert_eq` are imported into nearly every
script, so I think it's time to bring them into the top level of the prelude by
default.

title: Advent of Code Day 8
body:
Various improvements that came up while working on [Advent of Code Day 8](https://github.com/irh/advent-of-code-koto-2021/blob/main/08.koto).

- Improve span placement when parsing lookup chains
- Change list modification ops that return Empty so that they return the list
- Allow keys to be in different orders in map equality comparisons
- Add iterator.find
- Don't panic when accessing a reserved id in a temporary function

title: Advent of Code Day 7
body:
Some improvements that came up while working on
[Advent of Code Day 7](https://github.com/irh/advent-of-code-koto-2021/blob/main/07.koto).

- Add `number.round`
- Add an optional function to `iterator.consume`

title: Meta value assignment improvements
body:
- The `export` keyword is no longer needed to assign to a meta key, as meta keys can never be assigned locally.
  - e.g.
    ```coffee
    # Before
    export @tests =
      ...
    # After
    @tests =
      ...
    ```
- `main` functions are now defined using the `@main` meta key.
  - This is so that modules don't have to pollute their public exported API to take advantage of having a main funciton.
  - e.g.
    ```coffee
    # Before
    export main = ||
      ...
    # After
    @main = ||
      ...
    ```

title: Changes from Advent of Code days 5 and 6
body:
A collection of various issues I found while working on Avent of Code days
[5](https://github.com/irh/advent-of-code-koto-2021/blob/main/05.koto) and
[6](https://github.com/irh/advent-of-code-koto-2021/blob/main/06.koto).

- Fix typo in map.update docs
- Allow tuples as argument when constructing num2/num4
- Fix misleading error message when passing Empty as range end
- Fix error traces so that correct calling frame positions are displayed
- Listen to clippy

title: Advent of Code 2021 Day 1
body:
Miscellaneous improvements that came up while working on [Advent of Code Day 1](https://github.com/irh/advent-of-code-koto-2021/blob/main/01.koto).

- Replace individual .iter() functions with iterator.iter()
- Fix parsing functions that are passed as an argument on a new line
- Clarify 'unexpected type' error messages
- Add support for picking from Tuples and Maps to random.pick

title: Single-threaded runtime
body:
This PR switches Koto to having a single-threaded runtime.

Resolves #120.

title: Optimize calling functions with unpacked tuple args
body:
This PR optimizes calls to functions that unpack their tuple argument, making
common iterator operations more efficient.

Iterator chains like `foo.enumerate().each |(i, x)| ...` receive `ValuePair`s
from `.enumerate()`, and then collect the pair into a Tuple before calling
functors. This PR introduces the `CallArgs::AsTuple` concept, which allows the
runtime to collect the pair into a temporary tuple when the function is going to
unpack the tuple, avoiding unnecessary allocations.

This shows performance gains of a few % in relevant benchmark scripts.

Fixes #106.

title: Implement `cycle` iterator adapter
body: This is an attempt to implement `cycle` iterator adapter as described in #116.

title: Bytecode improvements
body:
A collection of improvements to Koto's bytecode

User facing improvements:
- Performance improvements
  - Size hinting when building strings
  - Optimized access operations
  - Only perform runtime validation of bytecode when debug assertions are active
- `not` behaviour is now split out from arithmetic negation

title: Improvements to the constant pool
body:
- Avoid lookup indirection when dealing with numeric constants
- Store the constant pool's string data in an Arc<str> instead of a String

title: Improved documentation in the lexer and parser
body:
- Enable #![warn(missing_docs)] in koto_lexer
- Enable #![warn(missing_docs)] in koto_parser
- Don't use temporary tuples when the result might be exposed to the user

title: Cherry pick the REPL fixes to v0.9.x
Fix some REPL bugs
body:
- Fix incorrect register assignment when compiling a negation expression
- Fix multi-assignment when using the REPL
- Tidy up returning a result from multi-assignment

title: Piped function calls
body:
This PR introduces the `>>` piped call operator.

Resolves #103.

title: Some small tweaks
body:
- Always display a map with its values
- Improve the error reported by the CLI when the script file isn't found
- Disallow `then` in match/switch arms with indented blocks

title: Windows support
body:
- Fix parsing strings that end with an escaped backslash
- Switch to using crossterm instead of termion in the REPL
- Better support for path handling on Windows
- Add support for Windows line endings
- Add os.os_name
- Add io.extend_path
- Add Windows to the CI build matrix

Resolves #93.

title: Importing improvements
body:
- Allow the use of strings in import expressions
- Add a runtime setting to run tests when importing a module

title: Make curly braces optional for inline maps
body:
- Restrict map block syntax to disallow values having multiple expressions
- Make curly braces optional for inline maps
- Add optional default values to list.get/tuple.get/map.get/map.get_index

title: Copyable generators and external iterators
body:
This PR fixes `iterator.copy` so that it works (roughly) as expected with
generators and external iterators.

A new `ExternalIterator` trait has been added to support this change, with the
additional benefit that meaningful size hints can be provided.

title: Function improvements
body:
- Add a test that validates the size in memory of the Value enum
- Allow functions to be called with missing arguments
- Rework list and tuple creation to use a sequence builder
- Throw a compiler error when a jump offset exceeds 2^16 bytes
- Introduce SimpleFunction for functions with no captures or special properties

title: Implement `From` for number types for Value
Iterator improvements
body:
- Add iterator.copy
- Add key function overloads for iterator.[min, max, min_max]
- Make copies of contained iterators when performing a deep copy

Resolves #90 and #92.

title: String interpolation followup
body:
- Remove the child_vm concept and allow active VMs to be reused by functors
- Fix using string interpolation with maps with overloaded display
- Make use of string interpolation in more tests and benchmarks

title: Fix bug with continuing expressions after lookups
body:
This PR fixes the parsing of continuing expressions directly after a lookup on the next line.

e.g. The following expression was triggering an error:
```coffee
foo.bar
  or foo.baz
# ^~~ Unexpected token error
```

title: Bytecode improvements
body:
- Rework ops that always make a ValueString from a constant
- Introduce a 24 bit ConstantIndex type
- Replace 32 bit 'long' constant ops with 8/16/24 bit ops

title: String interpolation
body:
This PR adds support for string interpolation.

e.g.

```koto
x = 42

"The answer is $x"
# The answer is 42

"$x divided by 3 is ${x / 3}."
# 42 divided by 3 is 14.
```

h/t @alisomay for the helpful syntax discussion.

title: Add exports getter to Koto implementation
body: This PR aims to to expose exports from the module by adding a getter named `exports` to the `Koto` struct implementation.

title: Allow indented calls on lookups
body: This PR adds missing support for allowing indented function calls on lookups.

title: Add koto_yaml lib
body: This PR adds a library for working with YAML data to `libs/`.

title: Tweak a few things
body:
This PR contains a collection of tweaks that deal with issues I've come across
in the last couple of days.

- Add num2/num4 length/normalize
- Allow lookups after parenthesized num2/num4 expressions
- Improve the readability of 'unexpected token' errors
- Allow indented lookups on indented assignments
- Return top-level compilation errors as a KotoError variant

title: Num2/Num4 improvements
body:
Improvements for Num2 and Num4 values.

- Allow num2/num4 elements to be set via indexing
- Make Num2 and Num4 iterable
- Add max/min/product core ops

title: Advent of code day 19 tweaks
body:
This PR includes some changes that I made while working on [Day 19 of Advent of Code 2020](https://github.com/irh/advent-of-code-koto-2020/blob/main/19.koto).

- Prevent the use of mutable values as key when using map.get
- Allow indexing a string with a range starting from one-past-the-end
- Allow throw and debug expressions to be used more freely

title: Fix using a quoted key for the first entry in a map block
body:
Fixes a regression introduced in `v0.7.0` that prevented the use of a quoted key
for the first entry in a map block.

title: Fix packaging of koto_cli
body: `cargo package` doesn't pick up the reference docs needed by the help system, so this PR symlinks them into the CLI's `src` folder where they're included automatically.

title: Improvements to the io module
body:
* Various `io` improvements, including access to `stdin`/`stdout`/`stderr`.
* Moved `string.print` to `io`. 
* Added an `--eval` option to the CLI.

title: Improvements for Strings and Iterators
body:
- Allow a function to be used with string.split when matching characters
- Add iterator.intersperse
- Add iterator.last
- Add iterator.to_string

title: Update the examples
body:
- Switch to using webpack in the wasm example
- Tweak the poetry generator example

title: Introduce ExternalValue
body:
This PR introduces a new approach to defining external value types, with `ExternalValue` replacing the somewhat cumbersome `Map`+`ExternalDataId` pattern.

See #65 for background discussion.

title: Add string.bytes and support for \x and \u escape codes
A couple of syntax changes
body:
- Ranges with indented operations can be written without parentheses.
- Omitting the value when defining a map entry is no longer allowed when using block syntax.

title: MetaMap followups
body: Following on from #69, this PR adds allocation-free access to named MetaMap entries.

title: MetaMap improvements
body:
This PR extends `MetaMap` so that it can include named entries, which allows for user-defined meta entries, and is also a pattern that can be used for defining tests.

This will also serve as a foundation for a more straight-forward approach to defining external value types: `ExternalValue` can be extended to include its own `MetaMap` to expose custom behaviour.

See #65 for background discussion.

title: String improvements
body:
This PR includes some improvements for Strings.

- Add support for indexing strings
- Add format string modifiers
- Allow strings to be created with single-quotes

Closes #59 and #60.

title: Core library improvements
body:
- The prelude is now searched when looking for a non-local value.
  - This makes the core library modules available by default without having to be imported first.
- `koto.args` is now a Tuple instead of a List (closes #61).
- `koto.script_dir` and `koto.script_path` are now Empty by default.

title: Add core library docs and a help system to the REPL
body:
This PR adds documentation for the core library and a `help` system to the REPL,
plus some minor tweaks that came up while going through the core library code.

title: Don't print map values in the REPL
body:
This PR adds alternate formatted output for `ValueMap`s, so that formatting with
`"{:#}"` will avoid printing out the values of map entries.

This is a good default when working in the REPL, in particular when importing
modules.

title: Add support for throw expressions
body:
This PR adds support for `throw` expressions, allowing errors to be created directly.

Strings or Maps that implement `@display` can be used as the value that gets thrown.

Closes #56.

title: Custom display formatting
body:
This PR adds the ability for a map to have custom formatting when using string formatting or `debug` expressions.

e.g.
```coffee
foo = |x|
  x: x
  @display: |self| "Foo ({})".format self.x
assert_eq ("{}".format foo 1), "Foo (1)"
```

See #54 for some background discussion.

title: Operator overloading followups
body: This PR includes some cleanups and fixes following on from #48.

title: Add bitwise operations
body:
This PR adds bitwise operations to the `number` module.

  - `number.and`
  - `number.flip_bits`
  - `number.or`
  - `number.shift_left`
  - `number.shift_right`
  - `number.xor`

```coffee
assert_eq (0b10101.and 0b00111), 0b00101
assert_eq (0b10101.shift_left 1), 0b101010
```

Closes #37, see the issue for some discussion regarding why these operations are being exposed as module functions rather than via operators.

title: Add support for hex, octal, and binary number literals
body:
This PR adds support hex, octal, and binary number literals, using the same syntax as in Rust:

```coffee
assert_eq 0b1000, 8
assert_eq 0o1000, 512
assert_eq 0x1000, 4096
```

Closes #49.

title: Add support for overloading operators
body:
Follows on from #40 and closes #36.

This PR adds the ability to overload operators on maps.

```
foo = |x|
  x: x

  # Arithmetic operators
  @+: |self, other| foo self.x + other.x
  @-: |self, other| foo self.x - other.x
  @*: |self, other| foo self.x * other.x
  @/: |self, other| foo self.x / other.x
  @%: |self, other| foo self.x % other.x

  # Comparison operators
  @<: |self, other| self.x < other.x
  @<=: |self, other| self.x <= other.x
  @>: |self, other| self.x > other.x
  @>=: |self, other| self.x >= other.x
  @==: |self, other| self.x == other.x
  @!=: |self, other| not self == other

  # Negation
  @negate: |self| foo -self.x

  # Indexing
  @[]: |self, index| self.x + index

  # Type
  @type: "Foo"

assert_eq (foo 1) + (foo 2), foo 3 
```

title: Allow access to the export map
body:
Closes #46 

Adds a function `exports` to the koto module. The function returns `ValueMap`, which represents the module's context. So now it's possible to modify the module's exports programmatically.

The PR changes `Vm::context_mut` to public method. It also makes `ModuleContext::global` a public field.

title: Wasm support
body: This PR adds initial support for compiling Koto to Wasm, and includes a basic example of a simple Koto editor running in a website.

title: Operator overloading
body:
#36 

Implements some methods, which previously was relying on `Ord`.

title: Backtraces in error messages
body: Runtime errors now provide a full backtrace.
